III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Criminal history check, subject to requirements; staff
Title qualifications
Rule Code & Rule 400.4112
Section (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
Description (a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth N alleged Staff 1 and Staff 2 gave her vapes on an
unidentified date.
Investigation Interviews:
I notified Complainant, also Doctor, via email that this investigation
was assigned. He expressed no additional concerns regarding
Vista Maria.
I notified Youth N’s MDHHS worker of the investigation, and she
expressed no additional concerns.
I interviewed Youth N at Kingswood Hospital on 2/1/24. She was
placed at Vista Maria in May 2023 and said she has been
psychiatrically and medically hospitalized four times since then.
She understood and agreed to comply with the ground rules of the
forensic interview.
Approximately October 2023, Youth N said she asked Staff 1 to
get her a nicotine vape. Staff 1 agreed and handed her a new
vape in her bedroom the next day. The bedrooms do not have
cameras. Youth N said the brand of the vape was Breeze and
flavor was strawberry kiwi – the kind sold at liquor stores and gas
stations. Youth N said she has been using marijuana and vaping
nicotine since she was age 12. She usually purchases the vapes
herself as she appears older than her age. Youth N said she hid
the strawberry kiwi nicotine vape under her mattress and used it at
night in her room until it was empty. Then she threw the empty
cartridge in the community bathroom trash. Youth N said youths
and staff take out the trash, and the empty vape would not have
necessarily been noticed by whoever disposed of it.
Also in October 2023, Youth N said she saw a vape in Staff 2’s
purse and asked her for it. “Staff 2 let me have hers with nicotine
left…She handed it to me in my room where there are no
2

cameras. I hit it three times and it went out. I threw it in the same
bathroom trash.”
Youth N denied receiving vapes from any other staff members at
Vista Maria. She said she is unaware of Staff 1, Staff 2 or any
other staff providing vapes to other youths.
On 2/27/24, during a forensic interview I attended at Kids-Talk
regarding another matter, Forensic Interviewer asked Youth N if
staff at Vista Maria ever gave her vapes. Youth N denied that any
staff, including Staff 2, ever gave her vapes.
I interviewed Staff 1 jointly with Government Worker 1 and Rights
Officer present on 2/8/24. She has worked at the facility for ten
months. Staff 1 said she has been assigned to monitor Youth N
on 1:1 and “every time, she acts a fool, banging her head.”
Government Worker 1 read the allegation aloud. Staff 1 stated “I
don’t even vape. That’s crazy she made that accusation. I know
she really doesn’t care for me.” Staff 1 denied knowledge of any
other staff giving youths vapes.
I interviewed Staff 2 jointly with Government Worker 1 and Rights
Officer present on 2/1/24. She said she was sometimes assigned
to supervise Youth N on 1:1. She said Youth N self-harms by
hitting her head on the wall, likes rap music and is religious.
Government Worker 1 read the allegation aloud. Staff 2 denied it
and asked “I gave her a vape? I don’t even smoke vapes.”
Documents reviewed:
I reviewed Staff 1’s and Staff 2’s employee records. Both had
attendance-based write-ups, but neither were disciplined for
displaying inappropriate behaviors toward youth. The facility
terminated Staff 2’s employment on 2/8/24 regarding another
matter.
There were no incident reports indicating Youth N was ever found
in possession of a vape.
I reviewed Vista Maria’s Employee Behavior Policy. It prohibits
giving gifts/items of value to clients without immediate supervisor
approval. It prohibits smoking on campus or in vehicles but does
not prohibit staff from carrying nicotine products inside of their
purses.
Government Worker 1 had no findings.
3

Analysis Youth N told Complainant on 1/28/24 and me on 2/1/24 that Staff
1 and Staff 2 gave her vapes at the facility. During a forensic
interview at Kids-Talk on 2/27/24, Youth N denied that any staff at
Vista Maria ever gave her vapes.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
